Case: Destiny-Adkins-MVA-04-16-2021
Client: Destiny Adkins
__RE: Adkins & Downs v Stephanie Nail & Allstate__
CC: "A. Campbell Ewen" [ACEwen@ewenandkinney.com](mailto:ACEwen@ewenandkinney.com), Beth Alexander [BAlexander@thattorneys.com](mailto:BAlexander@thattorneys.com)
Aaron and Ms. Tuttle:
With respect to service, I would simply note that the return actually attached to the electronic file on Courtnet just simply has the work COVID spelled out. Our position at this time is that this is not effective service. If you disagree or intend to file a motion for default, please let us know.
Second, while I should have confirmed at the time, my recollection is that we discussed a 30 day extension of the time to Answer by agreement. At this point, please let me know if you are opposed to an extension through August 1.
Finally, do you intend to move to amend the Complaint? If so, perhaps we should just wait to see what happens when you try to serve that on Ms. Nail.
Thank You,
Brian D. Stempien

Case: Destiny-Adkins-MVA-04-16-2021
Client: Destiny Adkins
__Your Personal Injury Claim - Defense Discovery Request__
CC:
Good afternoon Destiny,
 Please find attached a set of questions of the defense counsel related
to your motor vehicle accident that took place on April 16, 2021. We have
also mailed a copy via USPS. Please review and answer the questions to the
best of your ability as soon as possible. Your claim can not move forward
until these answers are received.
 We are on a 30 day deadline so these responses need to be provided to
our office before November 17th, 2022 in order to be reviewed and properly
drafted before we return them to the defense counsel. If you have any
questions, please do not hesitate to contact us to discuss them in further
detail.

CC: Greg Whaley [BStempien@thattorneys.com](mailto:BStempien@thattorneys.com)m), Bryce Koon [bryce@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:bryce@whaleylawfirm.com)
Good afternoon Counselors,
 Please find attached the Motion for Special Bailiff filed moments ago
via CourtNet Envelope 7387377. It appears Defendant Demetrius Turner
received notice from the Sheriff and set up an appointment to be served,
however, per the Sheriff Mr. Turner did not show for this appointment and
has stopped responding to the Sheriff's attempts to contact/serve him. At
this time, we are requesting a Special Bailiff be appointed to perfect
service. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us
directly to discuss them in further detail.
Sarena M. Tuttle

AI Summary:
Reviewing activity in Destiny Adkins MVA 04/16/2021 between 12/25/2024 and 1/24/2025...

This case involves a motor vehicle accident that occurred on April 16, 2021, involving Destiny Adkins and Juanita Nicole Downs against Demetrius E. Turner and potentially others. The case is currently in the discovery phase, with depositions being scheduled.
The most recent activity involves Bryce Koon, the attorney for the plaintiffs, requesting to schedule Mr. Turner's deposition. However, there appears to be a discrepancy as Mr. Turner claims he was not driving at the time of the incident. (See details), (See details)
A potential red flag in this case is Mr. Turner's claim that he was not driving, which contradicts the plaintiffs' understanding of events. This discrepancy may require further investigation and could impact the case strategy. (See details)
The recommended next steps are to review any evidence that proves Mr. Turner was driving on the day of the accident, as suggested by opposing counsel Eric Rice, and to follow up on obtaining Mr. Turner's responses to discovery requests if not already received. (See details), (See details)

episode_body:
Case: Destiny-Adkins-MVA-04-16-2021
Client: Destiny Adkins

CASE FILE ORGANIZATION COMPLETED - Roscoe (AI Paralegal) completed comprehensive file reorganization using 8-bucket system. RESULTS: 284 files successfully organized (86% complete) - Litigation (211 files), Investigation (23), Lien (11), Expenses (7), Medical Records (7), Client (3), Insurance (2). All files renamed with proper convention (YYYY-MM-DD - Client - Category - Originator - Description). REMAINING: 39 files in root require manual review - 17 hash-named .md files (not processed), 20 .eml files (litigation correspondence), 6 .doc files (unreadable binary format - need conversion to PDF). QUALITY REVIEW: 5.6% error rate (7/125 files) - corrected date errors, recategorized 1 police report, removed 1 wrong case file (05/01/2021 accident vs 04/16/2021). CASE INSIGHTS DISCOVERED: Complex multi-party case with co-plaintiff Juanita Downs; defendants include Stephanie Nail (vehicle owner), Demetrius Turner (driver who fled scene), and Allstate Insurance; bad faith claim against Allstate bifurcated and in abeyance; Turner has extensive criminal history and was difficult to locate for deposition; vehicle was reported stolen AFTER accident (not before), causing initial coverage denial by Allstate; active discovery disputes with Turner's counsel (Rice Gumm PLLC) regarding deposition scheduling and overdue discovery responses (60+ days overdue as of 11/01/2024). FILES NEEDING ATTORNEY REVIEW: 4 files with unclear/future dates requiring verification from CourtNet or client. All reports saved to Reports/ folder. Next steps: Manual categorization of remaining 39 files, convert .doc files to PDF, verify dates for flagged documents.
author: Roscoe (AI Paralegal)
